description.1: Our mission is to provide education and create future experts and scientists in the fields covered by our school program. We strive to inspire our students to develop a desire for learning and to become independent researchers and thinkers. We encourage them to explore and learn through various extracurricular activities. We created an environment where the student is at the center of the learning process. We want our children to become entrepreneurs and responsible individuals. We invite you to join us and help shape the future!
description.2: Their satisfaction and safety are our top priorities. We support our students in developing their creativity and skills. We created an environment that allows them to grow and learn. We want our children to become self-confident and independent. We invite you to join us and help shape the future!

teachers.title: Experienced Teachers
teachers.description: Our team consists of over 100 experienced teachers with rich experience and high qualifications. They encourage critical thinking and a love for learning. Every teacher works to develop our students' skills and knowledge. They are role models for our students and inspire them to become independent and responsible individuals.

students.title: Students in a Dynamic Community
students.description: Our school gathers over 750 students with different interests and talents. We support them in developing their skills and knowledge. We encourage them to explore and learn through various extracurricular activities. We created an environment that allows them to grow and learn. We want our children to become self-confident and responsible individuals. We invite you to join us and help shape the future!

classrooms.title: Modernly Equipped Classrooms
classrooms.description: We have over 40 modernly equipped classrooms with digital boards, laboratory equipment, and innovative software. The classrooms are designed to support teamwork, experiments, and multidisciplinary projects. We created an environment that allows our students to explore and learn in an inspiring environment.

awards.title: Awards and Recognition
awards.description: Our students have won over 25 awards at regional, national, and international competitions. They have shown exceptional potential in STEM projects, artistic challenges, sports, and debates. We support them in developing their skills and knowledge. We encourage them to explore and learn through various extracurricular activities. We created an environment that allows them to grow and learn. Every award is a story about their dedication and perseverance.

callToAction.title: Join our Educational Family!
callToAction.description: Open the doors to a future where tradition meets technology and every student is part of a success story. Visit us and see how we build a world that inspires!

segments.title: Founding of the first technical school in Zemun
description: The founding of the first technical school in Zemun marks the beginning of education in specialized technical disciplines.

This school made a significant contribution to the education of future engineers and technicians in the region. During this period, the school began teaching technical skills that were necessary for industrial development at that time.

segments.title: Relocation to a new building
description: In 1949, the school moved to a new building located in Nade Dimić Street. This building was modernly equipped for that time and provided better conditions for teaching.
The school then received an internship, which allowed students from other parts of Yugoslavia to be educated in it, making it an important center for technical education in the country.

segments.title: Name change to "Majstorska škola metalske struke"
description: On October 5, 1954, the school officially changed its name to "Majstorska škola metalske struke u Zemunu".
This name change reflected the expansion of the educational profiles towards the needs of the metal processing industry, which was growing at that time.
The programs were focused on training masters and workers for the metal industry, providing them with specific skills needed for work in that field.

segments.title: Name change to "Metaloprerađivačka škola za učenike u privredi"
description: In 1960, the school changed its name to "Metaloprerađivačka škola za učenike u privredi", which made it even more specialized in educating students for industrial sectors.
The school then enrolled 600 students, making it a key educational institution in the region.
The curriculum and program covered not only the metal industry but also electrical engineering and other technical fields, allowing students to acquire a wide range of skills.

segments.title: Name change to "Mašinski obrazovni centar"
description: In 1980, the school was renamed to "Mašinski obrazovni centar", which marked the expansion of the educational profiles and the introduction of new disciplines in the field of machine engineering.

The school began to focus on education in the fields of automation and mechanics, with the aim of providing students with advanced knowledge and practical skills for work in modern industry. Also, during this period, the school improved its laboratories and workshops.

segments.title: Name change to "Mašinska škola Zemun"
description: In 1987, the school changed its name to "Mašinska škola Zemun", which reflected its steady development and growth in the field of machine engineering.
The school became a leading educational institution in Zemun for the education of technicians and engineers, providing students with quality education that was in line with the needs of the industry.

segments.title: Name change to Elektrotehnička škola 'Zemun'
description: In April 2003, the school received the name "Elektrotehnička škola 'Zemun'", which clearly marked its specialization in the field of electrical engineering, computer science and modern technologies.

This change was a response to the accelerated technological progress and the need for education of experts in the fields of computer science, electronics, automation and other modern technical disciplines.
The school continued to provide education and preparation for the labor market, offering modern programs and resources for its students.

enrollment.title: Enrollment and Entrance Exam
enrollment.description: Join our community of future electrical engineers!

announcement: Dear students and parents, the 2025/2026 school year begins on Monday, September 1, 2025.
list: First and third grade: before noon (shift starts at 7:45 a.m.).
Second and fourth grade: in the afternoon (shift starts at 2:00 p.m.).
announcement.text: Classes will be shortened to 30 minutes. The reception, roll call and introduction of the champions to the class leaders will be from 7:30 in the school yard. The first two classes all students will have with their class leaders and from the 3rd class according to the class schedule. We wish the future champions and other students of the Zemun School of Electrical Engineering a happy start to the school year and much success in their studies! The collective and director of the Zemun School of Electrical Engineering!

courses.name: Thermal and Cooling Device Service Technician

it.title: Information Technology Technician
it.descriptionOne: The Information Technology Technician is a modern educational profile designed for students who want to specialize in the field of information technology.
it.descriptionTwo: After completing their studies, students are equipped to participate in the development of software applications, creating and developing databases, static and dynamic web presentations, as well as maintaining and verifying the security of information systems.

program.title: Educational Program and Acquired Skills
program.descriptionOne: During the four-year education, students are introduced to a wide range of knowledge and skills in programming, network technologies, databases, and computer hardware. This knowledge includes:
program.descriptionTwo: In addition to technical knowledge, students develop essential soft skills, such as analytical thinking, problem-solving ability, teamwork, and adaptability – qualities that are extremely important for success in the dynamic world of information technology.

programming.title: Programming and Software Development
programming.description: Working with modern programming languages, creating desktop and web applications, object-oriented programming

web.title: Web Technologies
web.description: Creating static and dynamic web pages, using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and advanced frontend and backend technologies

database.title: Databases
database.description: Design, implementation, and administration of databases, working with SQL and NoSQL databases

network.title: Network Technologies
network.description: Designing, configuring, and maintaining computer networks, working with network protocols and security systems

hardware.title: Computer Hardware
hardware.description: Configuring and maintaining computer networks, working with operating systems and software

knowledgeApplication.title: Teaching and Practical Knowledge Application
knowledgeApplication.description: The teaching process combines theoretical lectures and practical work in modernly equipped classrooms and laboratories, allowing students to immediately apply the knowledge they acquire through real projects and tasks. Practical teaching and professional practice further prepare students for work in a real environment, through collaboration with IT companies and institutions.

target.title: Who is this educational profile for?
target.description: The Information Technology Technician is an ideal choice for those who want to work with modern technologies, enjoy problem-solving, and want to be part of one of the fastest-growing sectors of today. Whether they plan to continue their studies or want to start a career in the IT industry right away, this educational profile provides a solid foundation for professional development and success.

administrator.title: Computer Network Administrator
administrator.descriptionOne: The Computer Network Administrator is a specialized educational profile that provides comprehensive training in designing, configuring, administering, and maintaining computer networks.
administrator.descriptionTwo: Upon completing their education, students will be qualified to install, maintain, and configure computer networks, work with various operating systems, and implement security measures for computer systems and networks.

program.title: Educational Program and Acquired Skills
program.descriptionOne: During the four-year education, students become familiar with the fundamentals of computer network design and implementation, network device configuration and maintenance, as well as operating system management. The program covers the following areas:
program.descriptionTwo: In addition to technical skills, students develop key soft skills such as analytical thinking, problem-solving abilities, teamwork, and communication—essential qualities for a successful career in the IT sector.

network.title: Computer Networks
network.description: Designing, configuring, and administering computer networks, working with network devices, topologies, and network protocols

security.title: Network Security
security.description: Implementing security measures to protect computer systems and networks, encryption, firewalls, VPNs, and defense against cyberattacks

hardware.title: Computer Hardware
hardware.description: Installing and maintaining computer systems, working with network devices, servers, and other infrastructure components

operatingSystems.title: Operating Systems
operatingSystems.description: Installing, configuring, and maintaining operating systems such as Windows, Linux, and UNIX for network operations

database.title: Databases
database.description: Designing, implementing, and administering databases, working with SQL and NoSQL database solutions

knowledgeApplication.title: Teaching Methods and Practical Application of Knowledge
knowledgeApplication.description: The teaching process combines theoretical lectures with practical exercises in modern laboratories, where students apply their acquired knowledge through real-world projects. By collaborating with industry partners and engaging in hands-on practice, students are well-prepared for professional work in the dynamic IT sector.

target.title: Who is This Educational Profile For?
target.description: This educational profile is ideal for students who want to specialize in network design, administration, and security, enjoy solving technical challenges, and aspire to be key members of teams that maintain digital infrastructure. It also provides a solid foundation for further education at technical colleges and universities focused on computing and networking.

electricalEngineer.title: Computer Engineering Technician
electricalEngineer.descriptionOne: The Computer Engineering Technician is an educational profile that enables students to acquire the necessary knowledge and skills for configuring, maintaining, diagnosing, and repairing computers, as well as for developing and implementing software applications.
electricalEngineer.descriptionTwo: Upon completing their education, students will be qualified in programming with popular programming languages, developing desktop and web applications, working with databases, implementing and maintaining computer networks, as well as administering network operating systems.

program.title: Educational Program and Acquired Skills
program.descriptionOne: Throughout the four-year education, students gain knowledge and skills in computer hardware, programming, databases, computer networks, and system software. These skills include:
program.descriptionTwo: In addition to technical skills, students develop key soft skills such as analytical thinking, problem-solving abilities, teamwork, and the ability to quickly adapt to new technologies.

programming.title: Programming
programming.description: Working with programming languages C, C++, and C#, creating objects in C#, developing Windows applications, and working with databases using ADO.NET.

web.title: Application Development
web.description: Developing and implementing applications for desktop and web platforms using modern technologies and software development tools.

database.title: Databases
database.description: Design and administration of databases, working with SQL and NoSQL databases, and implementing database connections.

network.title: Computer Networks
network.description: Designing, configuring, and maintaining computer networks, working with network protocols, and administering network operating systems.

hardware.title: Computer Hardware
hardware.description: Configuring computers, working with computer components, testing, diagnosing, and troubleshooting computer hardware issues.

knowledgeApplication.title: Teaching Methods and Practical Application of Knowledge
knowledgeApplication.description: The teaching process combines theoretical lectures with practical exercises in laboratories, where students have the opportunity to apply their knowledge by working on real-world projects and tasks. Practical training allows students to gain experience in working with computer systems, networks, and software tools.

target.title: Who is This Educational Profile For?
target.description: The Computer Engineering Technician program is an ideal choice for students interested in working with computers, whether at the software or hardware level, and who want to be part of the dynamic and constantly growing IT industry. This educational profile also provides an excellent foundation for further studies at technical and computer science faculties.

electricalAutomatics.title: Automation Electrical Technician
electricalAutomatics.descriptionOne: The Automation Engineering Technician is an educational profile that prepares students for work in the industry, focusing on automated production processes and the regulation of physical quantities such as temperature, level, flow, and similar parameters.
electricalAutomatics.descriptionTwo: Upon completing their education, students will be qualified for the installation, supervision, and operation of measurement and control systems, as well as working with computer systems for data collection and processing.

program.title: Educational Program and Acquired Skills
program.descriptionOne: Throughout the four-year education, students gain knowledge and skills in automatic systems, computer control, industrial robotics, and the regulation of physical variables. These skills include:
program.descriptionTwo: In addition to technical skills, students develop key soft skills such as analytical thinking, problem-solving abilities, teamwork, and the ability to quickly adapt to new technologies.

programming.title: Programming
programming.description: Working with industrial programming languages and technologies, such as PLC (Programmable Logic Controllers), SCADA systems, and microcontroller programming.

automation.title: Automation
automation.description: Developing and implementing automation systems in industrial processes, including measurement and control systems and the management of automated production lines.

robotics.title: Industrial Robotics
robotics.description: Learning about industrial robots, their programming, control, and implementation in automated production processes.

network.title: Computer Networks
network.description: Designing and configuring computer networks for automated systems, working with communication protocols, and maintaining data transmission systems.

measurement.title: Measurement Systems
measurement.description: Working with measurement instruments for physical variables such as temperature, flow, level, and other critical industrial parameters.

knowledgeApplication.title: Teaching Methods and Practical Application of Knowledge
knowledgeApplication.description: The teaching process combines theoretical lectures with practical exercises in laboratories, where students have the opportunity to apply their knowledge by working with industrial automation systems, robotics, and measurement systems.

target.title: Who is This Educational Profile For?
target.description: The Automation Electrical Technician program is ideal for students interested in working in industries with automated production processes, measurement and control systems, and industrial robotics, as well as those who want to work with computer automation systems.

electricalDevices.title: Electromechanical Technician for Cooling and Thermal Devices
electricalDevices.descriptionOne: The Electromechanical Technician for Cooling and Thermal Devices is a third-degree educational profile that prepares students for work in the installation, maintenance, and repair of refrigeration, thermal, and air conditioning devices.
electricalDevices.descriptionTwo: Upon completing their education, students will be qualified for designing and reading electrical schematics, diagnosing and repairing faults, as well as installing and servicing air conditioning and refrigeration devices.

program.title: Educational Program and Acquired Skills
program.descriptionOne: During the three-year education, students gain a broad range of knowledge and skills in electrical installations, thermal and cooling systems, as well as diagnostics and servicing of devices. These skills include:
program.descriptionTwo: In addition to technical skills, students develop key soft skills such as analytical thinking, problem-solving abilities, teamwork, and precision in work.

installations.title: Electrical Installations
installations.description: Fundamentals of electrical installations and computer-aided design, installations in thermal and cooling devices, and introduction to different types of electrical actuators.

thermal.title: Thermal Devices
thermal.description: Heat transfer methods, temperature measurement, temperature regulators, principles of thermal device operation, and electric heaters.

cooling.title: Cooling Devices
cooling.description: Cooling principles, operation of cooling devices, installation and servicing of air conditioning and cooling systems, fault detection, and troubleshooting.

diagnostics.title: Diagnostics and Repair
diagnostics.description: Performing independent diagnostics and repairs of thermal and cooling devices, identifying and resolving issues with electrical actuators.

knowledgeApplication.title: Teaching Methods and Practical Application of Knowledge
knowledgeApplication.description: The teaching process combines theoretical lectures with practical exercises in laboratories, allowing students to apply their knowledge through real-world projects and tasks related to thermal and cooling devices.

target.title: Who is This Educational Profile For?
target.description: The Electromechanical Technician for Cooling and Thermal Devices program is an ideal choice for students interested in working in service centers, industry, or installation of cooling and thermal systems, as well as those who want to specialize in maintaining electrical systems for households and industrial applications.

ppService.title: Psychological-Pedagogical (PP) Service
description: Our PP team consists of school psychologists
Ivana Maćešić
and school pedagogues
Anđela Mijović.
Our task is to provide support and assistance to students, parents and teachers. We follow and guide the development of our students and provide help in recognizing problems and finding solutions.
ppService.reachOut: Here are some situations in which you can contact us:
reachOutList: and school obligations (difficulties in mastering the material, fear of answering or negative grades, lack of motivation for learning, planning and organizing school obligations)

(stress, anxiety and similar, psychological pressure due to family or personal problems, difficulties in controlling emotions - sadness, anger, frustration ..., problems with self-esteem or self-confidence)

(problems with peers - bullying, misunderstanding, conflicts and the like, isolation or feeling of loneliness, difficulties in making and maintaining friendships, conflicts with teachers or other school staff)
(aggressive behavior, violating school rules, setting boundaries and resolving conflicts)
Transition periods and important life changes

(transition to a new class, school or city, adapting to a new environment or people, change in the family - divorce, death of a loved one, personal problems that affect concentration and school success)
(decisions on further professional development, researching the labor market, career planning, help in recognizing personal strengths and talents)
(memories of traumatic events, coping with significant life challenges and changes)
Talks about healthy lifestyles, coping with stress and stressful situations
Help in preventing addiction and other risky behaviors
ppService.moreInfo: We strive to jointly understand every situation and help you find solutions. We build a relationship of trust, acceptance and encouragement. We listen, talk and encourage - without blaming, labeling, belittling or moralizing. If a problem exceeds our competence, we will refer you to someone who can provide further support. You can schedule a talk with a psychologist or pedagogue through the class teacher or on your own.

helpOutsideOfSchool.title: HELP OUTSIDE OF SCHOOL
options: Youth Counseling Center, Health Center Zemun, Toplička 8, savetovaliste.za.mlade@dzzemun.org.rs 011/2616-288
NADEL (National Children's Helpline) number 116111 or contact them through the website www.116111.rs where you can anonymously write to mental health professionals.
Institute for Mental Health: phone numbers 063/868 1757 and 063/868 2217
Online support from the Psychological Society www.dps.org.rs
Schedule an online counseling session or find information about other types of support on the website svejeok.rs/mladi/podrska

bullying.title: Bullying
description: If you are a victim of bullying or someone from your environment, report it to the class teacher, PP service or the Student Protection Team and, of course, your parents.

In our school there is a Student Protection Team that provides support to students who are victims of bullying, discrimination, harassment, and neglect. From the teachers who are part of this Team, you can get advice and guidance on what to do if you are a victim of bullying or a witness to bullying.
Reporting bullying PDF

National SOS line for preventing suicide - 011 7777 000
SOS phone line for psycho-social support - 0800-200-201
Center for Protection of Human Trafficking Victims - phone number: +381 63 610 590.

antiBullying.title: What is school bullying
data: School bullying is violence that occurs in school, with the aim of causing harm to another person. However, bullying can also occur outside of school, but it is still considered school bullying. It can happen in the schoolyard after classes or on the way home from school, as well as online, through social media where children from the same or different schools are connected.

The most common forms of bullying in schools are verbal bullying (insulting, mocking, threatening), social exclusion (exclusion from social activities or communication with a particular child), and physical bullying (hitting, fighting). Unfortunately, exposure to bullying does not end after leaving school, but continues online - digital bullying.

In school, bullying can be committed by students against their peers, as well as by teachers against students. The perpetrators of bullying usually see the victim's material and intellectual status, national and sexual identity as the basis for bullying - i.e. discrimination. (text taken from the website of the organization 'I protect you')

understandingMentalHealth.title: Understanding the Adolescent Period
understandingMentalHealth.text: Adolescence is a period of intense changes that encompasses physical, emotional, and social development.
list: Physical Changes:

During teenage years, the body undergoes significant changes, including growth, development of sexual characteristics, and hormonal changes. These changes can lead to feelings of insecurity and self-criticism. It's necessary to adjust to the 'altered' body image. There is no adolescent who is completely satisfied with their appearance!
Emotional Changes:

Adolescents often experience intense emotions and mood swings, sensitivity, excessive self-criticism, and sometimes a tendency towards depressive moods, as well as daydreaming and withdrawal into their own world. This is a period of exploring one's own identity, which can lead to inner conflicts and conflicts with others. They often face the fear of rejection and the need for belonging.
Social Changes:

Teenagers begin to develop more complex social relationships. Peers and romantic relationships become key. Adolescents learn how to communicate, cooperate, and manage conflicts in situations they have not encountered before. These changes can be challenging and lead to stress, but also to the development of new social skills.

challenges.title: Adolescence brings numerous challenges and stressors that can affect mental health:

list.item: Social Pressure: Teenagers often feel pressure to fit into a group or meet peer expectations. This pressure can lead to anxiety and discomfort.
list.advice: You are not alone! Other peers around you feel similarly and go through the same dilemmas, even if it doesn't seem so at first glance!

list.item: Academic Stress: School demands, exams, and competition can be a major source of stress. Fear of failure can affect self-confidence and mental health.
list.advice: Give your best and do what is within your power to master something - ask for learning support, better organize obligations and time. Your internal motivation to achieve something and the measure you set and are ready to take responsibility for is what matters.

list.item: Family Issues: Family conflicts, divorces, illnesses, or changes in the family can affect the emotional well-being of adolescents.
list.advice: Seek support and help from a trusted adult or friend who can listen to you. Many around us go through similar dilemmas and 'crises', and only when we open up and say something, can we get help. Not everyone around us, no matter how close, is sensitive enough to 'read' our thoughts or feelings...

list.item: Identity Formation and Self-understanding: The process of discovering one's own identity can be confusing and emotionally challenging, leading to feelings of loneliness or insecurity.
list.advice: Discovering who we are, what we love, what we strive for... in some segments will last a lifetime. True wisdom is to love ourselves as we are! It is a process.

list.item: Technological Influences: The use of social media can be a double-edged sword, providing support but also bringing comparisons and burdens, which can affect self-esteem.
list.advice: Be critical of the information you find online. Check from multiple sources, compare, exercise the power of your common sense. Remember that those who post their photos on social media in their 'best' and 'happiest' editions also have 'hard' days, moments, and crises, just that few share it on social media...

challenges.conclusion: These changes and challenges in adolescence are critical for mental health development and can have long-term consequences on young people's lives. Support from the environment - parents, teachers, and peers - can significantly influence overcoming these challenges.

symptoms.title: Signs and Symptoms of Mental Health Problems
list: Anxiety: Symptoms of anxiety can include a persistent feeling of worry, tension, nervousness, and physical symptoms such as tachycardia, sweating, or trembling. Adolescents may have difficulty focusing, avoid social situations, or experience panic attacks.

Depression: Depressive symptoms may include feelings of sadness, hopelessness, loss of interest in activities that were once enjoyable, as well as changes in appetite and sleep. Adolescents may become withdrawn, show low energy, and have trouble concentrating.

Trap: In adolescence, depressive symptoms sometimes manifest in ways we would never expect - through hyperactivity, talkativeness, excessive exposure... Such behaviors, in that case, are a kind of dam or protection that a person sets up to be approached...

Stress: Stress can arise from various sources, including school obligations, relationship or family problems. Stress symptoms can include irritability, sleep problems, physical symptoms like headaches or stomach problems, and a general feeling of being overwhelmed.

identifyingProblems.title: Identifying Mental Health Problems in Adolescents Can Be Challenging, But There Are Signs to Look For:
list: Behavior Changes: Sudden changes in behavior, such as withdrawal from social activities, loss of interest in hobbies or activities they once loved, can indicate problems.
Mood Changes: Frequent oscillations, such as mood swings, anger, or constant sadness, can be a sign of problems.
Poor School Performance: Problems with concentration and a general lack of interest in learning can indicate deeper issues.
Physical Symptoms: Frequent physical problems without medical explanation, such as headaches, stomach pains, or fatigue, can be signs of stress or anxiety.
Isolation: Isolation from friends and family, avoiding social situations, and feeling lonely can indicate mental health problems.
Talking about Suicidal Thoughts or Self-Harm: Any statement about suicidal thoughts or self-harm requires immediate attention and help.
identifyingProblems.conclusion: It is important for parents, teachers, and other adults to be attentive and open to discussing mental health in order to provide support to adolescents facing problems. Early recognition and intervention can significantly impact the outcome and recovery. Sometimes it is a normal developmental phase, and sometimes it can be more serious signs that need to be prevented in time.

impact.title: Impact on Daily Life

list.title: Behavior at School and Home
list.description: Mental health problems can significantly impact adolescents' behavior in various environments, including school and home.
items: Behavior at School: Adolescents struggling with mental issues may show decreased motivation to learn, frequently avoid school obligations, or be absent. They may be irritable, have difficulty concentrating and completing tasks, which can lead to a decline in school performance. Sometimes, anxiety or stress can cause physical symptoms, such as headaches or stomach pains, further complicating school attendance.

Behavior at Home: At home, adolescents may become withdrawn, closed off, or have conflicts with family members. Parents may notice mood changes, frequent conflict, or a lack of interest in family activities. This dynamic can create a tense atmosphere, further worsening the adolescent's mental health.

list.title: Relationships with Peers and Family
list.description: Adolescents' mental health significantly affects their relationships with peers and family members.
items: Relationships with Peers: Adolescents facing anxiety, depression, or other problems may struggle to maintain relationships with peers. They may avoid social interactions, leading to feelings of loneliness and isolation. This isolation can exacerbate symptoms, creating a vicious cycle. They may also feel insecure in social situations, leading to conflicts or problems with friends.

Relationships with Family: Stress and mental health problems can cause conflicts in the family. Adolescents may be irritable or withdrawn, creating distance between them and their parents. Improper communication and a lack of understanding can lead to misunderstandings and conflicts. However, open communication and support from family members can help overcome these problems and strengthen relationships.

impact.conclusion: Mental health problems can have a profound impact on adolescents' daily lives, including their behavior at school and home, as well as relationships with peers and family. Early recognition and support can significantly help mitigate these problems.

parent.title: Role of Parents
parent.description: Parents play a key role in supporting adolescents during this important developmental period. Support can include:

communicating.title: Importance of Open Communication
communicating.description: Open communication is essential in relationships between parents and adolescents. It involves:
list: Establishing the Basis for Dialogue: Parents should create an atmosphere where adolescents can freely express their feelings and concerns without fear of criticism or judgment.
Active Listening: Showing interest in what adolescents are saying and understanding their feelings can help build trust.
Talking about Mental Health: Open discussion about mental health topics, such as stress, anxiety, and depression, can encourage adolescents to seek help if needed.

awareness.title: Recognizing Signs and Responding
awareness.description: Parents should be aware of signs that may indicate mental health problems in adolescents:
list: Pay Attention to Changes: Be alert to significant changes in behavior, mood, or school performance. This may include withdrawal, irritability, or a decline in learning.
Responding to Signs: If you notice signs of problems, it is important to respond immediately. Talk to the adolescent about your concerns and encourage them to seek professional help if needed.
Support: Familiarize yourself with available resources, such as school psychologists or therapists, youth counseling centers, etc.

parent.conclusion: Parents' active role in supporting adolescents, open communication, and timely response to signs of mental health problems can significantly impact young people's well-being.

teacher.title: Role of Teachers
teacher.description: Teachers can play an important role in supporting students' mental health by monitoring, creating a supportive environment, and collaborating with parents and professionals. Their role can significantly impact the well-being and development of adolescents.

improving.title: Strategies for Improving Mental Health
improving.description: Practicing self-help is crucial for improving mental health and well-being. This involves activities and habits that adolescents can incorporate into their daily routines:
list: Self-awareness: Understanding and recognizing one's emotions and needs is an important step in self-care. This may include keeping a journal where adolescents can write down their feelings and experiences.
Stress Management: Learning stress management techniques, such as planning and organizing obligations, can significantly reduce the feeling of being overwhelmed.
Setting Boundaries: Understanding the importance of setting boundaries in relationships and obligations can help preserve mental health.
improving.conclusion: By applying self-help strategies, relaxation exercises, and regular physical activity, adolescents can significantly improve their mental health and well-being. These strategies provide essential tools for managing stress and improving quality of life.

help.title: Whom to Turn to for Help
help.description: When adolescents face mental health problems, it is important to know where they can seek help. Some possible options include:
list: School Psychologists and Counselors: They can help solve problems or refer to further resources.
Doctors and Therapists: Pediatricians in Health Centers can be the first point of contact. They can refer to mental health specialists, such as psychiatrists, psychologists, psychotherapists.
Institute for Mental Health - Youth Counseling, Milana Kašanina 3, 11000 Belgrade (better known as Palmotićeva)
Clinic for Neurology, Clinical Center of Serbia, Dr. Subotića Starijeg 6
NADEL - National Child Line 166111
help.conclusion: All factors — parents, teachers, peers, and the community as a whole — play an important role in creating a supportive environment for adolescents. Through open communication, active support, and resource availability, we can help young people feel accepted. By providing support and understanding, we create a space where adolescents can successfully manage challenges and develop their mental health.

root.title: Electrotechnical School of Zemun
root.description: Learn about enrollment, education profiles, and benefits of studying at the Electrotechnical School of Zemun - a choice that opens the doors to a successful future.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: View and download important school documents - rules, plans, forms, and other official acts of the Electrotechnical School of Zemun.

history.title: School History
history.description: Get familiar with the rich tradition of the Electrotechnical School of Zemun and its key milestones throughout the decades.

teachers.title: Teachers
teachers.description: Meet the team of skilled and dedicated teachers who pass on their knowledge and shape future experts in the field of electrical engineering and computer science.

news.title: News
news.description: The latest news, announcements, and events from the Electrotechnical School of Zemun - stay informed about all important information.

profiles.title: Education Profiles
profiles.description: Overview of available education profiles and courses - learn what each profile offers and what are the conditions and opportunities for studying.

awards.title: Competitions and Awards
awards.description: Check out the achievements of our students at school, municipal, and national competitions in vocational and general subjects.

students.title: Students
students.description: Information for students - timetables, extracurricular activities, tips, and support for daily school life.

enrollment.title: Enrollment and Admission
enrollment.description: Everything you need to know about enrolling in the Electrotechnical School of Zemun - courses, points, conditions, required documents, and a guide through the application process.

it.title: Electrotechnician of Information Technology
it.description: Modern education profile for students who want to acquire knowledge in programming, databases, web technologies, and software development.

admin.title: Computer Network Administrator
admin.description: Profile focused on installation, maintenance, and security of computer networks - ideal for students interested in IT infrastructure and system administration.

pc.title: Electrotechnician of Computer Engineering
pc.description: Education profile that combines knowledge of electronics, digital technology, and hardware support - an excellent choice for students who want to understand and repair computer systems.

auto.title: Electrotechnician of Automation
auto.description: Profile that covers automation of processes, programmable logic controllers (PLC), and modern control systems - a combination of electrical engineering and industrial automation.

ac.title: Electromechanic for Cooling and Thermal Devices
ac.description: Practical profile that enables students to acquire skills for assembly, maintenance, and repair of cooling and heating devices.
